humanum_full_description_en:
It is said that the inscription of the word "ge" is like the shape of the head, the horns and the feet of the beast, and the hair is removed with both hands (see Lin Yiguang, Takada Tadajo, Gao Hongjin). Another said that the shape of the animal skin after the elephant is stripped is displayed. The upper elephant head, the middle elephant body, and the lower elephant tail. The back of its body gradually becomes a " mortar " (like hands) (see the inscription on the gold General solution).

The original meaning is leather, and the extension is the genus of the nails, such as E Jun Qi Car Festival: "Do not carry the golden leather strider (tortoise) arrow", and "Book of Rites. "The Golden Mean": "Golden leather, never tire of death, strong in the north", the " leather " refers to the genus of armor. Bronze inscriptions are often used as " Le ", that is, the title of horses, such as Kangding: "Mingnu (Ru) Youhuang, Jige", "Poetry. Xiaoya. "Caifen": "Silver fish clothes, hook and stubborn leather", and "Liao Xiao": "When you see a gentleman, you can rush through the leather", the " ge " is used as the " le " (refer to the text of the form and meaning ). See " Le ".

"Shuowen": "The removal of fur from animal skins is called leather, leather, and even more, just like the ancient Cultural Revolution." Xu Shuoxun "more also" is not the original meaning.
humanum_short_description_en: The shape of the animal skin after the inscriptions are cut and stripped. The upper elephant head, the middle elephant body, and the lower elephant tail. The back of its body gradually becomes " mortar " (like hands). The original meaning is animal skin.

It is said that the inscription of the word "ge" is like the shape of the head, the horns and the feet of the beast, and the hair is removed with both hands (see Lin Yiguang, Takada Tadajo, Gao Hongjin). Another said that the shape of the animal skin after the elephant is stripped is displayed. The upper elephant head, the middle elephant body, and the lower elephant tail. The back of its body gradually becomes a " mortar" (like hands) (see the inscription on the gold General solution). The original meaning is leather, and the extension is the genus of the nails, such as E Jun Qi Car Festival: "Do not carry the golden leather strider (tortoise) arrow", and "Book of Rites. "The Golden Mean": "Golden leather, never tire of death, strong in the north", the " leather" refers to the genus of armor. Bronze inscriptions are often used as " Le", that is, the title of horses, such as Kangding: "Mingnu (Ru) Youhuang, Jige", "Poetry. Xiaoya. "Caifen": "Silver fish clothes, hook and stubborn leather", and "Liao Xiao": "When you see a gentleman, you can rush through the leather", the " ge" is used as the " le" (refer to the text of the form and meaning ). See " Le". "Shuowen": "The removal of fur from animal skins is called leather, leather, and even more, just like the ancient Cultural Revolution." Xu Shuoxun "more also" is not the original meaning.

Basic explanation of words
leather
gÃ©
Processed animal skin without hair: leather. Leather shoes (leather shoes). Leather bag.
Change: innovation. Revolution (a. The original intent was to change destiny; b. Now refers to the mass movement to change the social system and build a new society; c. It also refers to the movement to transform old technology and old ideas). reform. change.
Cancel, get rid of: get rid of. Dismissal. Innovate the old (remove the old and build the new).
One of the eight notes of ancient Chinese musical instruments, such as drums.

[â‘ ]ï¼»gÃ©ï¼½
["Guangyun" ancient nuclear cut, enter the wheat, see. ]
(1) Processing the animal hides without hair.
(2) Human skin.
(3) Armor, armor, and shield made of leather.
(4) Soldiers.
(5) Military vehicles.
(6) Leather wine bag.
(7) Change; change.
(8) Rejection; exclusion.
(9) Refers to the revocation of office.
(10) Caution.
(11) Beware.
(12) One of the eight sounds. Refers to leather drum instruments.
(13) One of the sixty-four hexagrams in the Book of Changes, from the lower to the upper.
(14) One of the pulse conditions in traditional Chinese medicine. The finger pulse is floating and pulsing, hollow and firm outside, muddy like drum leather.
(15) The wings of a bird.
(16) The bridle. That is, Ma Luotou.
(17) Last name. In the Han Dynasty, there was a Gezhu. See "Han ShuÂ·Gao Hui Gao Later Wen Meritorious Table".
